body_html: I agree that having a context-manager API would be the best, but I don't think it's possible to implement. You'd have to capture the whole body (as Python code) and re-execute it in the backward, which can cause arbitrary side effects and is probably not what users expect. An alternative would be to run this in a tracer, but that's a more involved change and might require making the tracing faster (we weren't too strict about that).
